40552918.review:
I've already spent many hours in this game. Given the current size of the community (some say the community is dead), I honestly struggled a bit to get to just under 75 hours of gameplay. I'm trying my best to will my way to prestiging in the game versus pretty much all AI. It's a slog.

When the community was bustling during beta and the early days of early access, I was extremely happy. This game is so frantic and fun, I honestly enjoy it more than other arcade-y sports games like Rocket League. Where with Rocket League I feel like I'm always fighting with my controller, Laser League has very natural movement that make me feel in complete control. When I die in Laser League, it's usually due to a stupid mistake or an outstanding play by the other team. In Rocket League, I feel like I miss shots because, well, it's not exactly easy to control a flying car and hit a ball perfectly (though I still do love Rocket League!).

Anyway, people ask me if they should still buy this game right now. There's just no way I could possibly recommend it to anyone until one of two things happen: the developers pump massive money into marketing - we're talking advertising on a pretty massive scale catered towards sports enthusiasts and esports fantatics. Say, like during the NBA finals, World Series, Super Bowl all the way in 2019, or release this game on PS4 and other consoles, but make it a PS Plus game for a month to rope people in for free and give the game a much needed shot in the arm player base-wise. As it is right now, I'm seeing only 6 people playing the game at 8:30pm on a Saturday night (pacific time). That's tragically sad.

I will keep playing this game for as long as I can stomach it. Do I recommend this game? ABSOLUTELY! If you can get a free code or something. It's a ton of fun, especially with friends. But I just can't recommend a $15 purchase of this game - a heavily multiplayer dependent game - until the player base increases. Roll7, 505 Games, if you really want to save this game, a game that Roll7 has CLEARLY put a lot of love and effort into, you know what you need to do. Please make it happen.

40343200.review:
[b]Obs. Jogo com acesso antecipado, análise poderá sofrer mudanças com o tempo.[/b]

Laser League é um jogo de esporte futurista extremamente promissor, acredito que assim como Rocket League, pode vir a se tornar popular devido a sua originalidade e ideia inovadora.

[h1]Como o jogo funciona?[/h1]

Você joga em equipe de (2x2) e (3x3) no online e até 4x4 em partida local. O objetivo é eliminar o time oponente, acertando-os com os lasers que deverão ser ativados conforme vão aparecendo os nós. Poderá escolher entre seis classes, cada uma possuindo poderes e habilidades distintas. Há também nós de poderes que mudam drasticamente o curso da partida devido seu efeito como inverter lasers, reversão, velocidade aumentada entre outros.

O jogo utiliza o sistema "wall-wrapping" que basicamente é correr em direção a uma parede e automaticamente será teletransportando para o lado oposto. Contendo três mapas, cada um com quatro variantes diferentes, sempre terá nós surgindo em campo para serem ativados, assim como poderes. Então a ideia é tocar mais rápido neles de forma estratégica para encurralar o adversário e fazer seu ponto. 

(...)

[h1]Vale apena comprar agora?[/h1]

Não a jogadores suficientes para que você tenha uma experiência gratificante no seu principal modo que é o multiplayer. Normalmente jogará com bots no seu time. No entanto tem o modo local de até 8 jogadores que é extremamente divertido. 

Recomendo comprar Laser League quando se tornar um jogo popular, não só porque tem poucos jogadores, mas também pelas melhorias que o jogo necessita na parte técnica, equilíbrio das classes, polimentos, acertos no machmaking e mais conteúdo.

23/02/2018

40284444.review:
This game is a fantastic and completely unique experience, easy to pickup but hard to master.  If you're looking for a fun but competitive game with 15-20 minute matches of adrenaline pumping close calls and round-saving tight maneuvers and plays, this is the game for you.

It's a unique blend of strategy and action, as you race around a tightly confied arena activating your team's laser nodes to block in the opposing team while they try to beat you to them.  The different classes you can select have unique abilities that have great balance and add another layer of strategy and precision control to give you an extra edge over an opposing player that might be running toward the same laser.

Overall, the game runs great, is extraordinarily polished for early access game, and has lots of progression-based cosmetic unlockables that keep you coming back.  There's no pay 2 win elements, and no matter how advanced a player gets they get no boosters or abilities based on how long they've been playing.

The only thing is, if you start playing and get beaten alot in the first 1-2 hours playing, stick with it.  You'll get better before you know it and start figuring out tricks and strategies to beat the opposing team.

10/10

40272846.review:
Laser League is one of those special gems that appear out of nowhere and inmediatly not only catch your attention, but also genuinely surprise and hook you by their originality, simplicity, and sheer awesomeness.

Gameplay has simple yet original rules that work together to provide very fast, ever-changing action while still allowing for strategy, planning and skill. Arenas follow pre-established patterns in terms of barriers and power-ups, while players select their classes as they see fit, and can also change them between rounds. This, combined with "wall-wrapping" (running towards a wall teleports you to the opposite one), makes gameplay agile and fast-changing: tables might turn in seconds and players can work together coordinating their class abilities. In addition, controls are very simple and can be played both with keyboard&mouse (my case) or a controller (WASD to move around, LeftShift to walk, Spacebar to use your ability, mouse to aim skillshot abilities, and that's it). 

Art style is just gorgeous, with heavy Tron and cyberpunk influences and hard-light constructs: if you liked the film Tron Legacy, you will love playing this game! This combines with an awesome OST and tell-tale sound effects that ease-up gameplay. There are unlockable cosmetics for your character (gear, laser barrier style, emojis and portraits) that are unlocked by simply playing the game and the different classes. However, during matches, both the class of your character and other player characters can always be easily identified by their neon tools and visual effects. Energy levels (needed to use abilities) can be seen by all players at all times, so you can quickly tell if an opposing player might be about to try to pull out a trick.

In terms of performance, the game runs very smoothly, with no crashes so far (I haven't even seen them in the bug reporting subforum), and very good framerate. Most bugs or "areas to improve on" seem to be so far limited only to matchmaking and UI design (which is not difficult to read but could benefit from some improvements in the placement oof some buttons). In my personal experience, I have seen the matchmaker sometimes setting me on the wrong region (easily fixed in the Settings menu; I have also reported this as a bug), and against higher level players. However matchmaking seems to be one of the main priorities for the devs right now.

Speaking of devs, they seem to be very dedicated and in touch with the community, with a positive yet humble/feet-on-ground attitude towards priorities. From their latest blog, they are listening to player suggestions/requests and want to add ranked matches and tournaments and make the OST accessible, among many other ideas. They are also not in a hurry to make it full release, which is great as it gives lots of room for making the game as best as possible. 

For a game that entered Early Access just a week ago, after having a closed beta, it feels very much finished in almost all areas, with only some tweaks left to do and still having room for additional content such as more arenas, classes and cosmetics. It is quite cheap too!

Population-wise, while it doesn't have the largest playerbase yet, I can confirm it is already large enough to have no trouble finding players to play with in Europe server in peak times (around 21:00 GMT). Needless to say, the more players the easier will be to find people to play with and more popular the game will become and more players will join, resulting in an exponential population growth, so if you're eyeing this game wondering if you should try it, I say go for it and join us!

40261545.review:
This game is definitely worth the price in my opinion, especially whenever it ever goes on sale. So far it has a 2v2 and 3v3 mode for matchmaking and 1v1 to 4v4 for local gameplay. I highly suggest playing the matchmaking mode with friends mostly due to the fact that you'll likely have better communication and team balance, however, playing with randoms is not impossible.

I've seen this related to Rocket League and honestly there's only two main ways it is similar to me:

1) They are both E-Sports games
2) When you start, much of your success is based off luck and a little skill. As you progress, these values will reverse.

Pros:
1) Relatively quick matches
2) Excellent cooperative multiplayer
3) The only thing that distinguishes a low level player from a high level player is their cosmetic gear and skill.
4) Although some may argue, I feel that the classes are relatively well-balanced - IMO
5) Great Replayability 
6) There's still additional content to come (maps/cosmetic gear/classes?/etc.)

Cons:
1) You can't skip the starting scene of ranked games (as of 2/20/18).
2) For my friends and I, we occasionally run into network errors during ranked games where everyone is kicked from the match. My estimation on this is probably 1 out of every 8 games or so, give or take. It's not the worst but it's also not ideal.
3) I'm not sure where to check but just from matchmaking alone it seems that the player base is not very massive. 



TL;DR
Great game. Great price. Have friends? Yes? Buy Game.

40255512.review:
3vs3 Arena Kämpfe mit Lasern, Spezialfähigkeiten und der Möglichkeit, viele optische Verbesserungen freizuschalten. Sehr einfache aber auch sehr tolle Idee und Umsetzung. Noch dazu ohne allzu große Probleme für eins Early Access Spiel in diesem Stadium. Und LASERN!!!!

ABER: Die Entwickler haben noch einiges zu tun, was Sie allerdings bereits bestätigt haben. Das Balancing muss deutlich verbessert werden. Zwar sind die meisten Spezialfähigkeiten relativ ausgeglichen und haben eine gute Funktionsweise. Allerdings wird das Sniping von den fortgeschrittenen Spielern arg missbraucht. Das nimmt auf Dauer leider jeden Spielspaß, wenn ein Sniper von der einen Seite der Karte mit einem Schritt auf die andere Seite gelangt. 
Außerdem ist das Matchmaking verbesserungswürdig. Wenn man auf einem lausigen Level 4 ist, zwei Bots in das Team bekommt und dann gegen Lvl 14, 15 und einen Bot gematched wird, ist das dezent frustrierend - besonders wenn dann minimum ein Sniper im gegnerischen Team ist.

Ebenso bereits angekündigt ist weiterer Content wie beispielsweise neue Maps. Das Spiel hat eine Menge Potenzial und lässt sich gut "zwischendurch" zocken. Mein längstes Match war knapp neun Minuten plus circa eine Minute Matchmaking.

[Again, EARLY ACCESS REVIEW]

Gameplay
++ Interesting competitive sport concept.
++ Fun with friends.
+ Helpful tutorial.
+ Simple control-scheme.
- Strange game-finding.
- Clunky controls and performance.
- Execution is lacking.
-- Match-breaking glitches.
- Overall, needs more polishing.

Graphic Design
++ Glowiness is rad.
+ Interesting-looking characters and options.
- Sub-par to AAA-titles.

Sound Design
++ Beautiful, immersive, Tron-like sound effects!
+ Daft Punk-ish music.
+ Bass.

Other
+ Menu is mostly fluid.
- Game lacks "soul."

Bottomline
It's nice to look at, sounds amazing, though is rough in its performance. Some games that look better than this appear to run smoother. I like the concept, though it falls short of being optimal and optimized. Looking forward to its full release.

En une phrase : Extrêmement simple à jouer et extrêmement compliqué à maitriser.

Le principe est simple, du trois contre trois (ou deux contre deux),
dépend de vos préférences, mais comme on dit : plus on est de fous, plus Henri.
Chaque équipe active des lasers de sa couleur qui vont éliminer les adversaires au contact.
A cela s'ajoute 6 classes qui vont donner du piquant aux parties grace à leurs compétences :
étourdissement, meurtre au contact, meurtre à distance, vol de laser, invincibilité et bourrage d'adversaire.
La partie se gagne en 2 sets gagnants composés chacun de 2 parties gagnantes
(exemple : 2/3 3/0 3/1 => victoire équipe 1).

Les parties se passent TRES vite, il faut réfléchir ET agir.
"Quel est le meilleur chemin pour relever mes coéquipiers tombés au combat"
"Comment abattre l'adversaire sans me faire piéger"
vont être vos seules pensées pendant les quelques secondes que dureront la partie.
Oui, c'est court mais intense (on m'a dit que ça compte !)

En conclusion rapide, un jeu de stratégie et de réflexe, il faut autant être en capacité de
prévoir vos actions et celles de l'adversaire que de les mettre en pratique.
A jouer dans son coin avec des inconnus ou avec des copaings (à lire "ing", oui j'insiste)
en vocal.

Voila, voila, si tu veux plus d'info, envoies moi un message

Adran

Avec son look à la Tron et ses affrontements ultra dynamiques en 2 contre 2 ou 3 contre 3, Laser League m’avait séduit dès les premiers trailers.

J’avais par contre peur que les matchs soient un peu confus ou lassants, mais ce n’est absolument pas le cas et tout reste parfaitement lisible, même lorsque la zone de jeu est remplie de lasers.

Les six classes de personnages offrent une grande variété de composition d’équipe et vous découvrirez au fil de vos parties des combos dévastateurs.

Les rounds sont courts, intenses et la marge de progression est énorme. Entre la parfaite gestion du pouvoir de votre personnage, de vos déplacements, la synchronisation avec vos coéquipiers, la connaissance des arènes, des bonus, il y a vraiment de quoi faire et plus vous enchaînerez les matchs, plus le jeu deviendra intéressant.

Pour le moment les rencontres classées ne sont pas encore disponibles, mais un « niveau de joueur » caché est déjà implémenté, ce qui garantit des parties à peu près équilibrées.

J’espère sincèrement que les joueurs s’intéresseront au jeu car si c’est le cas, il est parfaitement taillé pour faire un carton et obtenir un succès similaire à Rocket League, c’est d’ailleurs tout ce que je lui souhaite car il le mérite déjà amplement !

40112260.review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Laser League requires players to use their class’ special abilities in conjunction with their teammates’ abilities to capture laser posts. Players must also dodge the opponent’s lasers and abilities at the same time. These simple and unique mechanics create an action filled multiplayer match which doesn’t usually take longer than 10 minutes.

[h1]Game Breakdown[/h1]
[u]Gameplay:[/u]
In Laser League the player is part of 3vs3 team or a 2vs2 team. The team’s goal is to defeat all three of the opponents and then win two out of three rounds. To do this, players must capture long, white posts called “nodes which will shoot out laser walls. These walls aren’t claimed forever and will time out eventually requiring teams to try and predict when nodes will be available to capture again.  While players of the same color can walk through theses laser walls, players of the opposing color will die if they touch the wall. Laser walls aren’t the only thing players can walk through! Players are able to walk into the wall which will allow them to warp to the opposite side which can help to avoid death. Players who touch laser walls don’t die permanently however as players leave behind a hexagon when they die which can be touched by teammates to revive them. This simple gameplay is easy to learn and pick up but is instantly an adrenaline fueled dodge fest. This isn’t the only tool in a player’s arsenal. 

Players are able to choose classes before they start the match and if they lose a round. These classes include Smash, Ghost, Thief, Snipe, Shock, and Blade. The Smash ability makes the player’s character move forward, knocking an opponent down if they hit them. Ghost can become invincible which makes it the medic class. Thief lets a player steal enemy nodes. Snipe has a teleport ability which kills any player between the teleport point and the player using the ability. Shock stuns in an AoE for a while. Finally, Blade works similarly to Smash, but if the player runs into an enemy they kill them. Each of these classes has an energy bar which must be filled to activate their ability. This helps to balance the classes as the lethal Blade class has the slowest recharge time. Classes each have their own two subclasses which can help define their role on the team even further. The class system adds a strategic layer to this game which really makes it shine. It makes the game require timing and allows individual skill to shine. Classes can also be changed at the end of a round by the losing team.

Team play is important also. By combining two or three teammate’s builds the game once again becomes more strategic. Smash can throw players into laser walls which Thief will steal. Blade can kill enemies knocked down by Shock, which helps because Blade has a small hitbox.  The amount of combinations is crazy and makes no match feel the same.
Another aspect which adds diversity to the mix is the fact that the game is played on multiple stages, each with their own node effects. One stage has the teams recreating classic shoot ‘em up gameplay by making nodes move at enemy teams which are separated by laser wall captured early on. Another stage has teams slowly capturing nodes to create inescapable traps, unless one is playing Ghost. The diversity is welcome and I’m glad the developers made the stages each feel completely unique.

Finally, there are power-ups which effect the laser players have captured. Reset allows players to remove possession of every node on the map, great for the team that is losing. Another power-up is divide, which creates gaps in both teams laser which makes them easier to dodge. Every power-up has a purpose and often helps the losing side make a comeback. This requires coordination for the opposition to guards a power-up.

Overall, this is great game for players who want quick action that requires reflex, skill, and teamwork

[u]Sound:[/u]
The sound in this game makes it feel like a real sport. The crowds cheer when a huge play is made and the laser make satisfying swoosh like sounds as they extend. The sound enhances the gameplay and isn’t distracting in any way. Audio cues in this game give great feedback too. There are unique sounds for a player’s death, resurrection, and ability use. These all help with the reflex portion of the game since it allows players who are nimble enough to quickly react.

 [u]Music:[/u]
The music is subtle and sci-fi in nature. There aren’t many instruments playing in the compositions which allows the music to blend into the gameplay and enhance it instead of distracting from it. The music, while subtle, is full of energy and can help pump the player up for their matches even further.

 [u]Graphics:[/u]
The graphics use a lot of neon colors so each element of a stage is instantly recognizable. The player also has a small triangle directly above their character to help identify which member of the team they are. What I enjoy about the art style is that it uses a matte graphical style so these bright colors don’t hurt player’s eyes. This is a smart design choice that I felt worked very well to, once again, keep all of the focus on the gameplay.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[u]Pros:[/u]
Great, unique gameplay
Pleasing art style
Enjoyable music
Great Audio with audio cues

[u]Cons:[/u]
Still has a smaller sized player base.

[u]Rating[/u]
[b]9/10[/b].

If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url]

Awesome game, I'm having loads of fun with it. You'll love it if you are competitive and enjoy fast paced games.

Long story short it's a "tron-themed bullet hell-like competition" 2vs2 or 3vs3 in which you have to activate lasers to kill opponents while dodging theirs. It's easy to jump into but hard to master: there are 6 different classes (each with 2 skill modifiers) to choose from, each of them has its own ability, offensive or defensive, and if a single combination of classes could be great on a certain map, it could be suboptimal on a different one so you'll have to coordinate with your team mates for an effective setup. If you lose a round, you can still rework your strategy and try countering your opponents with different classes, it's not all about reflexes.

Player population is still low (hard to find a match if you intend to play after 3 am or something) and there are still a few network hiccups here and there, but you can expect that since it's early access. Great game overall.

If you decide to join us see you on the pitch! ;)

Currently there are two multiplayer centered modes, 3v3 and 2v2. 

VS. Ai mode currently offers more game-modes for practice.

Matches last once one team wins best two out of three points in a game. A point is earned after winning best two out of three matches the laser based gameplay. 

PROS
-------
-Decent que times
-Variety of classes to choose from, not primarly focusing on just attack-classes
-Level progression system with large amounts of cosmetics to unlock
-2 different mods for each class

CONS
-------
-Matchmaking needs work, as it often ques low level players with veterans
-Occasional Network Connection problems, matches unexpectedly drop 
-The Menu UI can be clunky at times, especially during match-over.


SUMMARY
-------
Decent concept, with a slight learning curve with the variety of classes given. Matches often can feel both fast-paced and intensive. Best 2 out of 3 matches to win a point, best 2 out of 3 points to win the game. With skilled players, matches can take upwards to 15 minutes+. Communication is very important, as your opponent can gain an advantage when you attempt to revive a team-mate.

Hopefully the developers continue to support the game and fix connection issues with the server. Other than that this game is very enjoyable so far, hope to see it grow even more.

40059020.review:
Questo giovane e piccolo titolo attualmente in EA merita di essere giocato, più che recensito.

Sviluppato da Roll7 e rilasciato da 505 Games; Laser League è un videogioco sportivo/competitivo semplice da imparare e da giocare che vi permetterà di migliorare soltanto passandoci ore di gioco sopra; un piccolo esempio che mi può venire in mente è Rocket League.

L'idea alla base di questo titolo è fresca, diversa e fuori dagli schemi rispetto a tanti titoli che oggi ci troviamo davanti ed è per questo che MERITA assolutamente di essere giocato.

Il gioco consiste (per ora) in match 2v2 e 3v3 la cui formula sarà "al meglio di tre round". La prima squadra che riesce a portarsi a casa due round su tre vince la partita.

Dovremo imparare a destreggiarci fra laser e abilità cercando di buttare a terra l'intera squadra avversaria; vi sono 6 diverse classi:
- Blade/Lama: è capace di sferrare attacchi con la sua abilità per uccidere i suoi avversari;
- Smash/Sfonda: è capace di scaraventare lontano uno o più avversari tramite l'uso del proprio scudo;
- Snipe/Killer X: la sua abilità consiste nel creare una linea laser temporanea che permette di uccidere gli avversari;
- Ghost/Etero: ha la possibilità di diventare invulnerabile per qualche secondo, dandogli la possibilità di passare attraverso qualsiasi laser o abilità nemica;
- Thief/Ladro: Grazie ai suoi globi di energia, è capace di rubare laser altrui;
- Shock/Scossa: creerà un globo elettrico che metterà temporaneamente fuori gioco uno o più avversari.

Avremo a disposizione moltissime skin per i nostri campioni, per i laser, emoji e quant'altro, senza pagare uno spicciolo in più, ma solo dedicando altro tempo a questo fantastico titolo.

Graficamente risulta semplice, leggero ma comunque piacevole da vedere; anche se per i suoi colori accesi e per i suoi elevati ritmi di gioco; potrebbe capitarvi di vedere laser ovunque dopo averci giocato per troppo tempo.

Il comparto musicale non è degno di nota, anzi. Sicuramente qualche traccia musicale potrebbe far apprezzare ANCOR di più l'esperienza di gioco proposta.

La giocabilità è ottima: intuitiva ed istantanea.
A volte le hitbox possono essere esagerate e in certe mappe le differenze fra le classi si sentono eccessivamente; ma calcolando che è in Early Access e soprattutto lo è da pochissimo tempo; per me è uno strapollicione all'insù.

Credo che nel futuro questo titolo potrebbe facilmente essere un must have; spero di non sbagliarmi!

40058435.review:
[h1][b]FUTURISTISCHER HINDERNISLAUF[/b][/h1]

[b]Manche Entscheidungen sind ebenso mutig wie waghalsig. Und man trifft sie auf Leben und Tod. Das werdet ihr mit Laser League oft genug erfahren. Und die Entwickler wohl auch. Denn die haben einen reinen Mehrspielertitel erschaffen, der Casual-Gamern glatt die kalte Schulter zeigt. Und das wird Laser League entweder zum schwer erarbeiteten Erfolg oder ins jähe Verderben führen. Aber der Weg ist bereitet. Es kommt auch auf euch an![/b]

[h1][u]DARUM GEHT ES[/u][/h1]

Laser League ist euer Trendsport der Zukunft. Im Jahr 2150 kämpft ihr als Duo oder Trio auf dem Spielfeld futuristischer Arenen um die Vorherrschaft über bewegliche Laserbarrieren. Das Ziel ist, eure Gegner mit diesen Laserbarrieren zu rösten und gleichzeitig darauf zu achten, nicht von gegnerischen Barrieren geröstet zu werden. Jenes Team, welches zuerst alle Gegner zu Boden ringt, gewinnt einen Punkt. Wer zuerst drei Punkte holt, gewinnt die Runde. Wer zwei Runden gewinnt, gewinnt die Partie und geht als Sieger vom Platz.

Das sind die Regeln. Mehr gibt es nicht. So einfach ist die Welt. Oder auch nicht.

[h1][u]SO SPIELT ES SICH[/u][/h1]

Denn so schnell ihr die Grundregeln auch intus haben mögt, so sicher sorgt eine ganze Reihe von Spielmechaniken dafür, dass ihr auf dem Spielfeld ganz schnell von einer vertrackten Situation in die Nächste getrieben werdet.

Zunächst wären da natürlich die namensgebenden Laserbarrieren. Die werden aktiviert, indem ihr über deren Knotenpunkte lauft. Das fühlt sich wegen der eher winzigen Hitboxes zur Zeit noch etwas unpräzise an. Mir wäre es lieber, die Knotenpunkte bestünden aus physischen Objekten, die ihr via Tastendruck aktivieren könntet. Aber sei es drum. Wichtig ist, dass ihr möglichst viele in möglichst kurzer Zeit aktiviert. Das wird euren Gegner ins Schwitzen bringen. Oder euch. Wenn der Genger schneller ist.

Nach kurzer Zeit füllt sich das Spielfeld mit allerlei fies rotierenden Barrieren. Denen des Gengners sicher auszuweichen, wird dabei manchmal schon zur Kunst für sich. Um es noch fordernder zu machen, sind die Arenen-Grenzen durchlässig. Bedeutet, wenn ihr in die Begrenzung lauft, kommt ihr am anderen Ende des Spielfelds wieder raus. Wer diese Mechanik gut beherrscht, kann sich so schnell einen Vorteil verschaffen.

Außerdem erscheinen in bestimmten Abständen Items auf dem Spielfeld, deren Einsammeln bestimmte Ereignisse auslösen. Beispielsweise kann so die Team-Zugehörigkeit aktivierter Barrieren umgekehrt werden. Auf diese Weise können sich die Machtverhältnisse auf dem Spielfeld oft dramatisch ändern.

Schließlich verfügt ihr dann noch über eine klassenspezifische Spezialfähigkeit, mit der ihr beispielsweise Gegner betäuben, rammen oder töten könnt. Oder ihr stehlt damit gegnerische Barrieren und macht sie zu euren eigenen.
Zur Zeit gibt es sechs Klassen mit je einer Fähigkeit. Da sollte schon für jeden was dabei sein. Wichtig ist nur, dass ihr eure Klassenwahl auf die eurer Mitspieler abstimmt, denn das ist spieltaktisch häufig entscheidend.     

Und ach ja, Laser League spielt sich zur Zeit mit nur einer einzigen Taste. Plus Analog-Stick. Das wars. Über Tastenbelegungen müsst ihr euch also null Gedanken machen. Und das ist auch gut so. Denn das Treiben auf dem Spielfeld wird sehr schnell hyperkomplex und erfordert damit eure ganze Aufmerksamkeit.  

[h1][u]DAS GIBT ES ZU TUN[/u][/h1]

In Sachen Spielmodi sieht's zur Zeit noch sehr mau aus. Entweder ihr spielt in 2er- oder in 3er-Teams. Mehr steht noch nicht zur Auswahl. 

[h1][u]SO SIEHT ES AUS[/u][/h1]

Laser League ist vom Menü bis zum Spielfeld konsequent im futuristisch-abstrakten Grafikstil gehalten, bei dem sich grelle Farbakzente vor einem dunklen monochromen Hintergrund abheben. Das passt natürlich gut zu Thema und Setting des Spiels und es sorgt außerdem für die nötige Übersicht auf dem Spielfeld. Wenn die mal verloren geht, was durchaus vorkommt, liegt es also nicht an der Grafik.

Ein kleines Sahnestück des Spiels ist die tolle Präsentation, für die die Unreal-Engine mal ein bisschen ihre Muskeln spielen lassen darf. Die Arenen und Spielfiguren sehen einfach klasse aus. Match-Intro und Podium-Sequenz stehen dem in nichts nach, vor allem, weil das alles auch wirklich super animiert ist. 

[h1][u]SO HÖRT ES SICH AN[/u][/h1]

Weniger gelungen ist dagegen die akkustische Kulisse. Die Hintergrundmusik ist der Rede nicht wert und die Soundeffekte könnten aus meiner Sicht durchaus hochwertiger sein. Vor allem, wenn es darum geht, ein bisschen spielerisches Feedback zu liefern. Das gilt besonders für den Arena-Sprecher. Der könnte mit mehr und zeitlich besser abgestimmten Kommentaren helfen, das Spielgeschehen durchsichtiger zu machen.

[h1][u]SO FÜHLT ES SICH AN[/u][/h1]

Laser League bietet euch oft sehr spannende und taktisch fordernde Partien, die euch in Sachen Geschicklichkeit und Konzentration eine ganze Menge abverlangen werden. Umso mehr freut sich deshalb euer Belohnungszentrum bei allem, was ihr
richtig macht. Zu viele Partien hintereinander werden euch aber, als logische Folge eurer erbrachten mentalen Leistungen, deutlich spürbar ermüden.

Für längerfristige Motivation sorgen im Übrigen die Unmengen an freischaltbarem Zeugs, mit dem ihr eure Spielfigur individualisieren könnt.

[h1][u]SO LÄUFT ES[/u][/h1]

Zur Zeit gibt es doch noch eine Menge feinzuschleifender Ecken und Kanten im Spiel. Das Matchmaking ist langsam und fehlerbehaftet. Hin und wieder treten, wie beispielsweise bei der Podiums-Sequenz, lustige Glitches zu Tage. Vor allem aber ist nicht alles, was auf dem Spielfeld passiert, immer so richtig nachvollziehbar. Das merkt man natürlich am ehesten im Falle des eigenen unerwarteten Ablebens und sorgt hin und wieder für Frust. Vor allem die Hitboxes der Spielfeld-Objekte scheinen entweder noch recht fehleranfällig oder einfach unzureichend an die visuelle Darstellung angepasst zu sein. Da besteht auf jeden Fall Verbesserungsbedarf!  

[h1][u]DAS IST GUT[/u][/h1]

[list]
[*]Erfrischende Spielidee
[*]Mutiges Spielkonzept
[*]Tolle Präsentation
[*]Oft hochspannende Matches
[*]Sehr simple Steuerung
[*]Hoher Anspruch an den Spieler
[*]Ermöglicht und belohnt viele taktische Vorgehensweisen
[/list]

[h1][u]DAS IST SCHLECHT[/u][/h1]

[list]
[*]Nur zwei Spielmodi
[*]Hat noch viele Macken
[*]Belanglose, wenig hilfreiche Soundkulisse
[/list]

[h1][u]ZIELGRUPPE[/u][/h1]

Auch wenn Spielregeln und Tastenbelegung auf die Umrandung eines Bierdeckels passen; Gelegenheitsspieler werden mit Laser League nicht lange Freude haben. Für einen expliziten Mehrspieler-Titel eine sehr mutige Design-Entscheidung! Umso mehr profitieren alle Core-Gamer, Geschicklichkeits-Junkies und Taktik-Enthusiasten. Für euch ist Laser League nämlich wie gemacht.

Und wer weiß? Wenn die Entwickler es schaffen, der Spielmechanik ihre Ungenauigkeiten und Fehler abzugewöhnen, dann ist durchaus vorstellbar, dass Laser League zum Geheimtipp der E-Sport-Szene wird. Denn ausreichend befähigte Spieler können der Spielmechanik ohne zweifel wirklich spannende und dramatische Partien abringen. Da wird Laser-League ganz schnell zu einem Eiertanz auf LSD, bei dem man ganz im Sinne des sportlichen Wettbewerbs sein Können unter Beweis stellen kann.  

[h1][b][u]FAZIT[/u][/b][/h1]

[b][i]Das futuristische Laser League ist ein ebenso mutiges wie vielversprechendes Sportspiel für alle Geschicklichkeits- und Taktikenthusiasten. Und sein wahres Potenzial wurde zum aktuellen Zeitpunkt noch nicht einmal zur Gänze freigelegt.[/i][/b]

40029688.review:
Been playing this for a while.

It's not 100% perfect, but it's actually quite intense.

I'm not gonna summarize the game description, because that's what the store page is for. Only game review.

Price: (9.5/10) 
This is a bit tricky. Some say that a 10+ dollar game for a top-down isn't worth it. But the graphics and visual eye-candy negates that 10+ dollar comment. For the price of 15 dollars (At full price, and the fact it's in EA), ehh it's quite tough to say. The game develop has some history with completed games, as you can see from Roll7. So you can be assured that the game dev is capable of finishing game development. 505Games also published ABZU which was also, in my opinion, a great novel/story, with soothing graphics. So, there are evidence that this game would fulfill similar accomplishment as their history says so. So for your 10-15 dollar payment, I think it's fair to say that you'll receive a fully finished game.

Gameplay: (8/10)
The game is a quite repetitive. I like various maps this game has to offer. Modifiers are great, classes are great as well. There are so many places to develop more. 6 classes is a bit small, maybe 10 would be nice. Some powerups are Overpowered, while others are useless. The reason why I put 8 out of 10, is MAINLY BECAUSE CONTROLLERS ARE INFINITELY BETTER THAN KEYBOARD USERS. When you breakoff and chase toward the center of the map for the node, a controller user will always outpace a mouse/keyboard user. 
This game is very flexible when it comes to multi-user play, from multiplayer, online, LAN, online coop, LAN coop, etc. No to cross platform, as I dont think there are any other platform this game allows. Although I would like to see a MAC compatbility of this game. Half my friends use MAC, but can't play this game. This game is very fun when you play with friends, and of similar skilled players. This game said that there would be ranked matchmaking, which I'm very excited about, but it doesn't exist yet.

Visual Option: (5/10)
Sure the game looks great, but there isn't much choice of option about graphics setting. I'm not sure whether or not the game devs actually need to allow users more choice of graphics setting option, but just two choices seem quite restrictive. 

E-sports ready?: (7/10)
I see potential, but I don't see it going for millions of players. Maybe 25,000-40,000 players, at most.

Story: (3/10)
Why are players even participating in this tournament? Why are there so many things to unlock? I feel like we'll unlock everything before EA is finished. A season mode against AI would be great. 

What I would love to see:
- In-game Tournament mode. Where teams can sign up for tournaments Bo5 matches with 8 teams. Single Eliminations. A trophy case profile for tournament history. This game's background and audience can support a tournament theme.
- Season mode matchmaking. An in-game tournament held every end of season, where it supports like 32 best teams. All done through the game's menu, and maybe on the weekend (Fri-Sun).
- First Person Perspective. First Person Mode would be epic to see.
- A zoom-in function would be great. Not everyone has a 27+ inch monitor to see things going on in the game. If a 14 inch monitor user can see like a 27 inch monitor user, that would be great. Sure zooming in may cut out the rest of the arena, but it's something players can choose to decide.
- In-game chat feature, is very buggy. It doesn't always work properly or at all, if that's the case.
- I would love to see a feature option that allows users to choose whether or not they would like to play with competitive settings or casual settings in game, casual would be Best of 3, while competitive would be best of 5 (with 5 rounds), or using 5 different maps in competitive mode.
- Visual option that would support color blind users, difficult to see your own player unit, when it looks like your ally's.
- Player indicator would be nice, like brighter than allies, or something like that.

40024492.review:
Such a cool little game..,..check out my video reivew here : https://youtu.be/HRv4ULo6Hfo

=============
Graphics 9/10
=============
From the well designed menu screens, brightly coloured lasers zipping around the arena, to the subtle lighting from the distorted figures of the crowd, The graphics in laser league look fantastic throughout. I was a little concerned my eyes would hurt after 5 minutes of gameplay after looking at screenshots but Roll7 have done a great job in making laser league look sublime.

=============
Gameplay 9/10
=============
The gameplay in laser league is smooth, fast, fluid & exciting. Load up into an online matchup to see you stood side by side with your random teammates gives you a real sense of togetherness. With no time to wait, this game has your adrenaline pumped from the start in this futuristic sport of cat and mouse. You will Dodge, dive, speed up, knock, slash or steal your way around the arena with your chosen class as you battle it out for control of nodes enabling your team to light up the arena in as many of your team’s coloured lasers as you can whilst denying your rival of the same objective. Laser league is a high-octane experience that will have your heart pounding as you look to weave & negotiate through many tight spots fully immersing you from start to finish. You gain a real sense of pride as you either bash an opponent into your laser or quickly beating them to activation of a node & watching as your teams bright coloured laser slice’s right through them. We Love it! 

===========
Value 10/10
===========
Upon release laser league is priced a £10.99 & currently with a 30% discount on steam. We believe laser league is fantastic value for money. This is especially for a game that is as complete and as optimised as it already is for an early access title. Great value!

==========
Audio 8/10
==========
As expected the soundtracks and various in game sounds are of an electronic theme. This of course falls in line with futuristic feel of the game. With a very cool voiceover announcement every time a power-up is activated the whole sound content works very well.

============
Content 7/10
============
The balance of content at launch is just about right. For me, Roll7 hasn't tried to bite off more than they can chew, meaning, they haven't overloaded the game with so many modes & options thus causing a higher potential for issues upon release. Currently you have 2v2 or 3v3 online match ups with the chance for character customization upon completion a match. We feel in the near future more content needs to be added, which we will come to next...

==============
Potential 8/10
==============
Laser League has the potential to be a very good sports title on the market. We believe though, in order to survive, Roll7 has to add a competitive element to the game very similar to league of legends ranking system. Also I believe another cool feature to add, would be an offline career mode where you can rise through the leagues with your chosen team, buying selling players, managing finances with promotions & relegations.  

==================
Replayability 6/10
==================
We feel this is where their is a big question mark over the title. Without a competitive element & other features added, Laser league is a game you could quite easily get bored of quickly. I have been taking note of responses by the Roll7 and it seems they are happy to listen to the community for suggestions of how to move the game forward. Of course, only time will tell how they develop the game, but i really hope they continue to add content into what is already a solid entry onto the sports genre. 

===========
Social 9/10
==========
The whole game revolves around online match-ups as mentioned... but what i really like is, the emojis you can unlock & use in game. Light up a happy face as you smash into your opponent. trigger  a wave emote to grab a teammates attention when you have fallen. From my experience so far laser league has a friendly community. A simple “GG” typed in chat at the end of the game by players, instead of the usual flame & abuse you can receive playing other games. With the option to team up with friends or side by side with randoms laser league has a great social element to it.

==============
Technical 8/10
==============
For an early access release we have been very impressed how optimised, stable and complete laser league is. Over the weekend since release I have seen some grumbles of connection issues, personally the game has run just fine but I have read this is something Roll7 are working on. With the release of many early access games on the market in an unplayable state Laser league has done a great job in giving us a game with very few bugs & glitches. 

===============
Developers 8/10
===============
I will always say, as with any title, especially an early access title you can determine how well a game is received & progress’s when it is clear how active & enthusiastic developers are. Of course, we will have a clearer picture of this as the game develops but from what I have seen so far Roll7 are very active across social media. Most notably for me on twitter where they are very active in engaging in the community and more than happy to listen to suggestions & feedback.

==============
Overall 82/100
==============
So what do we think of laser league overall? Well, For a niche game, laser league has made a very solid entry into the sports genre. Offering a cool fast, fluid experience with an original futuristic feel that looks and plays fantastic. With great value... laser league offers something different to your game collection even for those who wouldn't normally look to purchase a sports title. If roll7 add a competitive ranking system & an offline career mode as mentioned the game will be around for a long time. With similarities to the highly successful Rocket league, there's nothing to stop laser league standing side by side with them. We score laser league a fantastic 82/100 so go & give your piggy bank a shake and grab it! 


Graphics - 9
Gameplay - 9
Value - 10
Audio - 9
Content - 6
Potential - 8
Replayability - 6
Social - 9
Technical - 8
Developers - 8
Overall - 82/100

40020792.review:
A really entertaining game. The classes may seem imbalanced, but people just haven't learned to play them well. The maps aren't random so there's a pattern to learn in each, but that's only a good thing! There's no other way to allow teams to plan their strategy if the patterns/powerups are random each round.

Laser League has more buttons reserved for quick chat and emotes than actual controls, but it works really well. There's quite a bit of customization and a ton of skins to unlock but no loot crates, which is a plus IMO.

It's a bummer that the online play doesn't support local parties but so far I've had a lot of fun solo queuing. Matchmaking is the biggest con currently. It's possible that there aren't enough players yet (steam charts shows about 100-500 during the day, more at peak hours) so you're often playing with or against bots, sometimes both. I had a few matches yesterday where the opposing team had 2 bots and 1 human player against our full team of humans and it didn't seem fair at first (since we pretty much 2v3 hard bots with my non-gamer girlfriend) but somehow the match was quite even. Maybe Roll7 saves the hardest bots for online matches?

But! It's kind of too early to say anything. It's a fun game, that I can say! There's a lot to unlock and achievements are probably enabled soon, since I already see them on my library. The soundtrack and crowd cheering gets me really pumped but also kind of tires me fast as well. There's a lot of [i]"holy &¤#t I am bad..."[/i] and [i]"What did I just do, wow that was cool!"[/i] moments which leave me laughing out loud or facepalming hard, and I can't really ask much else from a game these days.

All in all, do I recommend it? Absolutely. It's a shame it's not more popular but anything can happen in early access. Once Laser League gets a few streamers and youtubers to try it, people will pour in, but in it's current state it doesn't offer enough competitive gameplay (ladders and ranking) to make it really interesting. I'd love to play it but it's hard to get friends to buy it, which would probably double the fun. 

Buy it! It's a fresh(ish) idea and you should help it grow!

-Hin und wieder treten Netzwerkfehler auf, allerdings nicht all zu oft.
-Manche Klassen finde ich aktuell noch etwas unbalanced wie z.B. Shock > Betäubungsdauer imo minimal zu hoch
-Ungerechterweise eine z.Zt. noch etwas kleine Community. Dieses Spiel hat wesentlich mehr Spieler verdient und ich hoffe, das noch einige von euch dazu kommen werden :)

Smooth gameplay. Character movement feels great despite the Bird's Eye View camera,
Unique classes. Each class plays VERY different from eachother.

The $15 price drop is steep for me. I'd definitely buy it on sale.

40011643.review:
Overall fun game to play, with friends or alone with strangers.

Content-wise the game is quite limited, but as with any game (especially Early Access) it rides on its main feature, the game modes and not the customisation/map variety. The only difference between this E. Access game and others is Laser League actually has a working, fun foundation to build upon, rather than the buggy alternatives prevalent in the E. Access market. So far, no DLC or microtransactions - it is just buy-to-play - which is how games should always be monetised.

The only downside is lag for Canadian players, which is game-breaking. Server stability (i.e. forced disconnects) is its own issue that will be inevitably fixed over time, but latency is a big problem for Canadians. I'm not sure what the exact numbers are, but it feels like the game is running over 100ms ping at times (based on my experience with MOBAs and shooters), and 100ms is way too high for a game that depends strongly on precision. It's something as simple as an enemy beating you to a point at the start of a round. Or something more complex, like running over a downed teammate, seeing them revive, but then finding out a second later that apparently you hit an enemy laser. Local matches are plenty evidence that the game is almost bug-free, which is impressive, but seeing as online play makes up the majority of this game, the developers really need to work on improving latency for several regions globally.

40000458.review:
Хреновенькие модельки персонажей, чопорность анимаций, крайне скудный онлайн. Большего не придумать, т.к. остальное в игре достойно. 

Не смотря на EA хочется отметить, что основа игры уже присутствует и позволяет оценить игру по достоинству, но сначала, если не считать туториалы, всё очень размыто и игра идёт от лазера к лазеру. Спустя буквально нескольких игр (боты порой дают такую математику против игрока, что можно реально улететь на собственном пламени) уже начинает проясняться суть игры - доминация. Можно конечно поймать противника, но если игроки хотя бы на старте понимают расположение и характер лазеров, а так же есть опыт игры как своим, так и персонажами противника, то тут начинается самое интересное...

Напряжение не спадает от начала и до конца каждого раунда, музыка постепенно меняется и очень очень очень доставляет любителям синтвейва (таким как я, пусть даже там только отголоски жанра). Геймпад ни на секунду не смолкает, а игра всё идёт и идёт... постепенно, ошибка за ошибкой контроль над картой прыгает  то туда, то сюда, а игроки всё чаще открывают свои карты, применяя способности порознь и вместе.

Не забываем про соус! Киберпанк тут сомнительный, но он очень чувствуется и, что самое главное, подвязан в некоторой степени на реальность: стадионы, страны, марки формы и пр. Персонализация конечно слабенькая, но сама атмосфера толпы, красочных пейзажей и арен, музыка. Всё это подкупает и помогает погрузиться в жестокий мир лазерного спорта.

Если будут мотивировать игроков и набивать контент, то игра выйдет отменная. Тем, кто не застал беты - хотя бы попробуйте, т.к. на релизе (8 февраля) и чуть далее будет скидка.

39994214.review:
Laser League is probably the most fun I've had in a competitive game, in a very long time.
I dont think any of the trailers do the best job at explaining how simple the game is, so heres my shot.
Each class has 1 ability, that you can apply 1 modifier to. The goal of the game it to eliminate all enemy team members, Either through making them run into lasers that you can activate, or through your ability, and sometimes a mixture of both. The matches I have played were extremely fun. Sometimes I would get completely destroyed by the Snipe class and think 'WOW! This class is broken.' But then I would go and attempt to play the class and not nearly be as good. Skill is reqired. I would like to see an ability indicator so that I could see which way the attack would go, in specific for the smash and blade classes. I strongly recommend a control to play this game, mouse and keyboard works, but if you have the option, controller is the way to go. In my opinion, this game is extremely polished for an Early Access title, that could definitely become a big game. I look foreward to more classes being addded in the future, as well as more cosmetic options. Hopefully us Early Access backers could get an in game bonus. My one complaint deals with the smash class, which feels a little unfair to be hit against. I would suggest removing the stun and decreasing the knockback distance, while still keeping it sizable. All in all I think its a great game, but I'd probably go for a free to play approach with this one. The larger the player base the better for this game IMO. And if not free, then maybe 5 bucks. Thanks.

39988246.review:
Frantic and fast paced action that requires quick reflexes and even quicker thinking.

The way it works is the first team to have all of it's players knocked out loses. So if two players are out but one is still up then they have a chance to revive their team and keep the round going. If they fail then they lose.

First team to win three sets wins the round and the first team to win two rounds out of three wins the match. This makes some games go fairly quick with only lasting around 10 minutes but if the teams are fairly even on a low laser count field it could last slightly longer than 20 minutes.

There are a few different arena to play in but they really just determine the team colours (Red v Blue, Neon Green v Neon Purple, Neon Blue v Neon Orange.) As well as the background colours. What does change between them is the layout of the laser pylons. Each arena has about 3-4 different layouts that could be chosen from which helps keep the game fresh.

Right now the only modes are 2v2 and 3v3 with plans to add other modes down the line. With the community being small at the moment you will tend to run unto the same players every now and then but that's no different than Rocket League.

The few personal negatives I have right now is not having team side voip to help plan things at round start or during the match. There also doesn't seem to be a back out button once you select match making thus locking you on that screen until you find a match and then select quit. Though doing ao doesn't free your spot for anither player so your team now has an AI in your place. And finally the cosmetics pool seems a little shallow. Yes, it gives 250 some odd options but they are just full suits with several different decal variations. I'm assuming its to make it easier for the colour changes with teams so I'm super upset by this. The games has also only been out for three days at the time of this so I would think that number will either go up or they will add more in-depth customisation.

Pros outweigh the cons on this by far so I would definetly recommend picking it up 👍

39982404.review:
Laser League ist das neueste Werk von Roll7, welche hinter Spielen wie OlliOlli stecken. Laser League ist dabei ähnlich erfrischend wie OlliOlli zu seiner Zeit. Es hebt sich von der Masse an Spielen ab, die nach Schema F konzipiert sind, und bietet trotz hoher Zugänglichkeit ein anspruchsvolles Spielerlebnis.
Ich selbst bin durch Zufall auf das Spiel gestoßen, da es ja nicht groß beworben wird und damit bei vielen Spielern unter dem Radar fliegen dürfte-zu Unrecht! In letzter Zeit kann ich mich an kein Spiel erinnern, bei dem ich von der ersten Minute an einen solchen Spaß hatte. Das Tutorial ist nach 3 Minuten beendet und damit kennt man auch alle im Spiel enthaltenen Mechaniken. Die Spieltiefe besteht im Meistern der sechs Klassen und den verschiedenen Arenen. Als Klassen stehen zur Verfügung: 
[list]
[*]Blade: Kämpfer, der Gegner mit seiner Klinge ausschalten kann
[*]Ghost: kann sich selbst für kurze Zeit Unverwundbarkeit verleihen. So kann er Laser passieren und sonst unerreichbare Verbündete wiederbeleben
[*]Shock: erzeugt ein elektrisches Feld um sich herum, welches Gegner für einen kurzen Zeitraum bewegungsunfähig macht-die Laser erledigen im Idealfall den Rest
[*]Smash: besitzt ein Schild, welches aber nicht zum Blocken, sondern dem Angriff dient. Gegner werden in Stoßrichtung geschleudert und fallen hin. Führt sie ihr Fall durch einen Laser, so sterben sie. Am Ort des Aufpralls sind sie ebenfalls kurze Zeit betäubt.
[*]Snipe: markiert einen Punkt auf dem Feld, zu dem er sich zurückteleportieren kann. Dabei kann er unbeschadet Laser auf dem Weg passieren. Gegner, die seine gerade Linie zum Zielpunkt kreuzen, werden ausgeschaltet
[*]Thief: feindliche Laser kann er bei Einsatz seiner Fähigkeit in eigene umwandeln
[/list]
Diese Fähigkeiten haben jeweils einen Cooldown. Dieser ist zwar nicht sehr hoch, aber man muss sich trotzdem überlegen, wann und wie man die eigene Fähigkeit am gewinnbringendsten einsetzt.
Ziel des Spiels ist es, als Team den letzten überlebenden Spieler zu stellen. Dabei können Gegenspieler entweder durch Fähigkeiten ausgeschaltet werden (z.B. Blade) oder sie werden von den Lasern pulverisiert. Die Laser sind auch der Aspekt, der dem Spiel seinen besonderen Reiz verleiht. Wir sind als Spieler nicht nur vor feindlichen Fähigkeiten auf der Hut, wir müssen vielmehr das sich stetig verändernde Spielfeld im Auge behalten, da die Laser die größte Gefahr darstellen. Jede Arena kommt mit eigenen Lasermustern daher. Manchmal sind es Laserwände, die einen zu zerquetschen drohen, ein anderes Mal schießen die Laserstrahlen von einem Punkt der Karte in Sternform in alle Richtungen. Diese Laser werden von den Spielern aktiviert. Jeder Laser hat dabei einen Knotenpunkt, der für das eigene Team aktiviert wird, sobald man diesen passiert. Die Dynamik auf dem Spielfeld sucht ihresgleichen. Rocket League ist dagegen ein Spiel zum Entspannen. Abseits der Fähigkeiten bewegen wir uns über das Spielfeld und versuchen Laser zur aktivieren und feindlichen Lasern auszuweichen. Ein Kniff ist hier, dass man von einer Seite auf die gegenüberliegende springen kann, in dem man gegen eine der Wände läuft. So kann man den Gegnern in den Rücken fallen oder Lasern ausweichen.
Wer einmal von Gegner oder Laser getroffen wird ist aber nicht automatisch raus aus der Partie. Ähnlich wie die Laserknoten, kann man auch gefallene Mitspieler durch das Passieren der Todesstelle wiederbeleben. So ist das Spiel ein einziger Adrenalinstoß...achso, habe ich schon erwähnt, dass es auf der Karte noch Powerups gibt? Werden diese aktiviert, so teilen sich Laserwände in Abschnitte und erlauben ein Durchkommen auf die andere Seite. Die Geschwindigkeit der Laser wird erhöht oder deren Bewegung komplett angehalten. Die Laser der zwei Parteien werden umgedreht, so kann man durch ein Powerup das komplette Spielfeld verändern oder man aktiviert mit einem anderen Powerup alle Laserknoten für das eigene Team auf einmal.
Wen das Spiel auch nur im Entferntesten interessiert und wer durch diese kurze Review auch nur Ansatzweise Lust auf das Spiel bekommen hat, dem sei gesagt, dass das Erleben all dieser Elemente so viel besser ist als jeder Fließtext. Durch Videos kann man den Spaß erahnen, aber wenn man den Controller (der wirklich empfehlenswert ist) dann erstmal in der Hand hat, dann bleibt es selten bei einer Runde. Das ist aber auch kein Problem, denn an einer Partie sitzt man selten länger als 5-10 Minuten, so dass Laser League auch ideal für Zwischendurch taugt.

Ein wirklich herausragendes Spiel.

39981353.review:
Highly recommend, concept is fairly basic but the execution of it is great. Haven't had any issues finding a match yet the controls are solid not too stiff or too loose. When you get hit by something you don't feel like it's the games fault or lag (which can be the case for games similar to this) you can clearly see it was your own fault.

It seems fairly well balanced class/skill wise. I don't have much time in the game yet but from what I have played I haven't seen a class and felt like it was the only way to play or that it was really even superior to another one. They all have pros and cons and depending on the playstyle you want to play there is a class/skill for you.

There is also quite a lot of customization options for the game only being out a couple days so far, not in the sense of freedom but the amount of different unlockables (outfits, emotes, player icons). All of which are unlocked through actually playing the game and leveling up. No crates or anything, it's crazy!

I would highly recommend this to really anyone, it seems like it would be fun for casual or for competitive players (although there is no actual ranked game mode yet, fingers crossed).

39968022.review:
As of the moment writing this, I am rank 3 on the overall rankings and rank 1 for Shock rankings, so I feel I am pretty qualified to leave this review. Overall, I'm going to say this is a positive review, but I have some thoughts/concerns hopefully these devs and future devs consider and take to heart.

So, first off, the game is fun. That's simple enough. Any game that releases needs to be fun. That was accomplished.

However, I have legitimate concerns about the longevity of the game and how the game will feel in even a week.

First off.. The game is dead on Twitch already. That's bad. What happened to the advertising for the game? The #1 rule of advertising is it costs money to make money from it. There aren't nearly enough big streamers (if at all?) playing the game. You guys should have paid some big time streamers to show off your game. You can't launch a game that already feels like it's dead on arrival on that perspective. Worse games than this have had more viewers on Twitch, so there was an advertising fail here.

Second.. Obviously, no ranked playlists on launch. I think every multiplayer based game should launch with a ranked playlist. People want that carrot on the hat to chase. And currently, cosmetically, there is none. So I'm Level 14, I've done 4 of the 5 mastery ranks for Shock, and I can hardly tell a difference between anything. So there isn't even a cosmetic chase, so for those thinking maybe at Level 10 the skins get a lot cooler -- They don't.

Third, now for some gameplay. Meta wise, I think every 3's team is required to have a Thief. Thief is really strong and really dominates especially in premade teams. The chain rezzing really needs to be nerfed. There are games where you feel like you have it wrapped up, but one guy is just chain respawning on another to stall for time for a convenient laser node to protect them, or a lucky powerup like switch/steal to spawn on them. 

The map that has Four Y shaped lasers on top and bottom that all spawn at start is probably the worst map in the game. Switch and Steal are both really awful powerups as well in the sense that you get punished for playing really good to that point. And Switch and Steal always seems to conveniently spawn near the team that is losing so even when you have map control, you can't stop them from getting there safely. The other map that has Switch and Steal in their powerup rotation is basically a coin flip, and you can almost make the case you should play that map around intentionally letting the other team dominate the laser nodes early so you can switch/steal on them.

At the games core, it's fun. For it's price, I'd say it's worth it even if you only get 5-6 hours out of it. But I find it hard to believe this game will be thriving even in two weeks with how little advertising and precense it has on Twitch. But if the goal was at its core to make a fun game, a fun game was made in my opinion. But there was a huge missed opportunity and hopefully my review along with my gameplay feedback is noted by these and future devs.

39966607.review:
This game is a hell of a lot of fun playing online with friends and looks promising for more fun in the future. Hectic, fast paced and skillfull plays with a nice selection of classes, laser maps and powerups make for a game that is never over until it's over. Turning the tide of a round is pretty much always possible if you play well enough and the general style and aesthetics lend well to the design and theme. I absolutely love that, as simple as the game concept is, the ambient sounds, music and the arena crowd make every match feel like the world cup finals in your favourite sporting event. Definitely has a massive futuristic sports feel to it and I love it!

For the peeps who want more technical and involved review; The various classes all bring something very specific to the table and all have been very well thought out. Each one feels very powerful and useful for the team. There are some very powerful combinations, but also almost always a way to counter them with your gameplay skills, rather than just class A "counters" class C, for example. Despite the actual arenas all being very similar, it is the laser node mapping that is the real environment you need to pay attention to. Each laser map has different spawn timers and locations for different laser node types. Learning these and utilising them at the best time is the best way towards victory and feels bloody awesome.

There are always going to be bugs and issues with games, but Laser League is currently fairly well polished, with only one or two bugs noticed thus far after playing through the beta test and now early access. The bugs do not detract much from the overall experience, as they are usually brief and are not 'game-breaking' as such. Kudos to the devs for all the polish evident in this title and I have high hopes they will continue to refine LL as they go towards full release.

39963878.review:
There's such a glut of multiplayer games that it's hard for me to get excited about any of them. It's always some stale variant of an FPS MMO RPG MOBA survival whatever. The last multiplayer I got into was Rocket League because of how different and unique mechanics it had on offer.

I didn't expect much going into the game, just as was in the case of Rocket League. Yet much to my surprise, this is one of those games that brings something fresh to the table and executes the idea well. I've only begun to scratch the surface of what is possible here, but from my brief time with it I can already tell I'll be coming back for more in the coming months.

39963608.review:
Laser League is one of the best multiplayer experiences I've had in a while, it's just THAT much fun!

The game is simple, try to eleliminate your opponents by downing them all using lasers moving in different directions when stepped on. Try to activate as many lasers as possible for your team to pressure the enemies until they hopefully make a mistake and gets touched by one of them.

While it may sound a bit confusing coming from someone like me, who for the most part is terrible at explaining things, once you get into the game and finish the tutorial everything is crystal clear.

Compete in various arenas, customize your character and special ability to your liking. The special abilities makes for some really interesting gameplay and makes each game feel new and exciting. 

However, just like any game there's always a but. In this case it goes something like this: 

This game is A LOT of fun, great performance, very intense and thrilling gameplay, at a fair price, BUT it suffers from a low playerbase. As of writing this there are somewhat over 500 players in-game, which isn't ideal for a multiplayer game the day after release, on a Friday where a lot of people has got paid.

Most of my games end up with at least 1 AI player, if not all players besides me. And when you find other players it can be people from anywhere in the world, for example I'm in Sweden and has gotten put into games with Korean players.

Now luckily as I mentioned there are AI players, and they aren't bad. If it weren't for the "AI" names they're given I wouldn't have doubted that they were real players, so even if you can't find any multiplayer games, the single-player experience is also a lot of fun and challenging. 

I really hope the game will manage to keep at least a decent playerbase, as it's one of the most interesting games released in a while. (in my books)

I highly recommend Laser League for anyone looking for a fun and competitive game, but if you're worried about spending money on a "dead game" you may want to wait for a few weeks to see how the player-count will change!

39956969.review:
Это по настоящему захватывающая и динамичная игра сталистически вдозновленная играми серии TRON, а правилами напоминающая старые добрые "вышибалы".
Вам предстоит участвовать в сессионых матчах, в которых потребуется выйграть два раунда из трех. Игра предоставляет вариативность тактик, которая достигается путем использования персонажей разных классов, коих достаточно много для такой незамысловатой игры.
Итак, цкль игры заключается в выведении из строя противников. Эта самая цель может быть достигнута тремя способами:
1) Вы можете захватить и удержать бОльшее количество лазерных заграждений, об который противник убьется по своей неловности;
2) Вы можете убить противника прямыми атаками;
3) Комбинированный способ.

Атмосфера созданная прекрасным визуальным стилем и музыкой не оставит вас равнодушными, однако провести в игре несколько часов подряд у вас врядли получится, уж слишком все вырвиглазное. Будем надеяться, что игра получит положительный отклик от аудитории, будет развиваться и превратится в кеберспортивную десциплдин, т.к. потенциал тут есть огромный.
Рекомендую всем как для сольной игры, так и для игры в команде с парой друзей. Однозначно стоит своих денег.

39956708.review:
เกมนี้โคตรเจ๋งอะ เห็นลดราคารีบซื้ออย่างไม่ลังเล สนุกแปลกใหม่สร้างสรรค์ เหมือนเกิดมาเพื่อเป็นอีสปอร์ตเลยนะเนี่ย

การเล่นเกมนี้คือ จะมีเสาเลเซอร์โผล่ขึ้นมาในสนาม ถ้าเราหรือทีมเราวิ่งไปโดนเสานั้นแผ่นแสงเลเซอร์ก็จะยืดออกมาเป็นสีของทีมเรา ถ้าคู่แข่งมาโดนเลเซอร์ของเราก็จะตาย ตายหมดทีมก็จะแพ้ กติกาง่ายๆ อิอิ(หึหึหึ)

เสาเลเซอร์จะมีหลายรูปแบบ สังเกตุตรงขีดๆที่ยื่นออกมาจากฐานเสา บางก็เป็นแผ่น บางก็เป็นแฉก เสาจะเคลื่อนที่ไปมาแล้วหายไปและโผล่ขึ้นมาใหม่ ดังนั้นเราต้องดูไว้ตลอด ยืดเสาไว้เยอะๆก็ได้เปรียบบีบพื้นที่วิ่งของคู่แข่งได้ก็มีโอกาสชนะสูง แต่เกมนี้ไม่ได้มีแค่นั้น

เกมนี้จะมี "คลาส" ให้เราเลือก 6 คลาส ซึ่งจะมีความสามารถแตกต่างกัน
1.Smash(สแมช) กระแทกคู่แข่งกระเด็นกระดอนสมชื่อ
2.Ghost(โกสต์) โดนอะไรไม่ตาย โดนกระแทกก็ทะลุไปเลย ผีจริงๆ
3.Thief(ตีฟ) สามารถขโมยเสาเลเซอร์คู่แข่งให้เป็นของเราได้
4.Snipe(สไนป์) วางจุดตำแหน่งไว้แล้ววาร์ปกลับมาที่จุด คู่แข่งที่โดนเราระหว่างทางวาร์ปกลับก็ตายเลย
5.Shock(ช็อค) จอมสตั้นแห่งลีค
6.Blade(เบลด) พุ่งฟันคู่แข่ง สายคิล 5555+
โดยการใช้อบิลิตี้(เหมือนเป็นสกิล) จะต้องรอหลอดพลังงานชาร์จเต็มถึงจะใช้ได้ ใช้แล้วรอชาร์จใหม่
แต่ละคลาสจะให้เลือกความสามารถเสริมอีก 2 แบบต่อคลาส เช่น สตั้นนานขึ้น ชาร์ดพลังงานไวขึ้น กระแทกโดนแล้วอมตะแปปนึง บลาๆๆ

ถ้าเพื่อนตาย เราสามารถวิ่งไปชุบชีวิตเพื่อนได้ เพียงแค่วิ่งไปตรงที่เพื่อนตายแค่นั้นเอง หุหุ
นอกจากนี้ในสนามยังมี Power-Up เป็นไอเท็มโผล่มาบนพื้น เก็บแล้วจะมีผลต่างๆ เช่น เปิดเลเซอร์ที่เสาว่างๆให้เป็นของเราทั้งหมด ชุบเพื่อนทุกคน ฟื้นพลังงานฝั่งเรา ลดพลังงานฝั่งคู่แข่ง ทำให้เสาเลเซอร์เร็วขึ้นหรือช้าลง สลับเสาเลเซอร์ของเรากับคู่แข่ง บลาๆๆๆ

- เกมนี้ใช้จอยเล่นได้ ออกแบบมาเพื่อใช้จอยเลยก็ว่าได้ นั่งพิงเบาะเล่นสบายๆ การควบคุมก็จะมีวิ่งกับกดอบิลิตี้ ควบคุมง่ายๆสนุกสนานครับ 555
- กดอีโมได้ 4 แบบแล้วแต่เซ็ตไว้ กดข้อความสื่อสารได้ 4 หมวด
- พอเราเล่นไปเรื่อยๆเลเวลอัพก็จะปลดล็อคชุดต่างๆ หรือลวดลาย รูปโปรไฟล์ และอีโม
- เซิร์ฟดีมากๆ ผมใช้เน็ต 4G ยังไม่แลคเลย

39953427.review:
I no longer have a lot of time to play games -- maybe just a few hours each week, if I'm lucky.

So I am generally forced to weigh my play options very carefully. (sadness!)

Last night, I decided to play 2-3 games of Overwatch, my game of choice right now.

Then I decided to give laser team a try, for maybe an hour. 

I liked it a lot, and definitely intend to play it more, probably a lot more.



It's an interesting game that definitely draws you in.

The core mechanisms of play are relatively simple.

But to play it well, you need to process a ton information very quickly.

I found it very fast paced -- maybe too much so.

But I can already sense it probably offers some substantive potential for team strategy and maneuvering. 


 
And on that note, it definitely does have the right ingredients to make it a valid esport -- which, for me, is always a point of attraction.  

I guess the key question, though, is whether it has the right stuff to make me stop playing a game like Overwatch.

... in other words, the question is whether there is enough in the game to make me choose it over a AAA title that has a definite future...

Hrm.... yeah... well... I guess we'll see.


I can certainly say this:

I woke up thinking about Laser League this morning, rather than Overwatch.

And at the moment, I know which of the two games I am probably going to reach for the next time I play. :)

That's a start.

We'll see if it sticks.

39945068.review:
Rocket League meets Tron. If you are a fan of either, there's a good chance you will enjoy this game. The goal of the game is simple. Activate lasers to take out your opponents. The first team to win 3 rounds twice wins the match.

There are currently six classes to choose from. Each class has their own unique ability to aid you on the pitch. They vary from being able to steal lasers, knock or shock opponents, take them out with a blade, snipe them, or go ghost to avoid activated lasers.

I had the opportunity to try the game out in the open beta and instantly fell in love. I hope the game lives up to its full potential. The devs seem to very interested in community feedback, which is a plus.

Pros:
[list][*]Fun concept
[*]Similar to Rocket League/Tron
[*]Dev activity/involvment in the community
[*]Free cosmetic unlocks as you level up give you something to strive for[/list]

Cons:
[list][*]Some server issues at launch
[*]Needs more content in the long term (i.e, single player season mode, more customization options, more arenas, etc.)
[*]End-round match rank up notifications take too long and can't be skipped

I am having a blast with this game.  It really came out of no where for me.  Its hard to describe, really.  Watch the trailers and interviews, you'll get an idea about what the game has to offer, but I think this is one that has to be played to really "get it". 39943959.review:
Laser League is a competitive multiplayer sports video game that highlights combat, speed, strategy, teamwork, quick matchmaking, and of course, intense competitive gameplay. Built around the concept of an extreme contact sport set in the year 2150, players on one of two sides of a battle arena must scramble around the area once the match has begun in order to active nodes that emit beams of light that stretch out and sweep the area, killing any enemy player it touches instantly. There are several battlefield nodes such as Speed, Switch, Reverse, Divide, etc., that can change the course of the match in an instance due to the overwhelming influence these nodes have upon created and existing beams of light on the battlefield. Players have several classes to choose from with two individual modification options per class that can give you and your teammate(s) a bit of an advantage. The game is well balanced and truly relies on your skills, ability to stay focused, and to stay one step ahead of your opponents. You must maintain this level of focus while maintaining awareness of your surroundings and teammate activity.

Roll7 has done a magnificent job in making a video game that captures the authentic themes of the cyberpunk genre. Everything from the environments to the distorted voice of the announcer is very much appreciated by true fans of cyberpunk. There are dozens of customization options for your character that allow you to change their appearance, (outfit), via different in-game brands, emoticons, designs for the laser beams of light that you activate, (individualizing you from your teammates), and your portrait. Roll7 also did a superb job of creating an absorbing atmosphere that gives personality to the world that surrounds you. A world in which the risk of competing in this sport is life or death. A world that rewards the players of this extreme sport with glorification and admiration. Giving off this gladiator-like  sense of pride and determination. This game is a MUST HAVE for gamers and I strongly recommend it to anyone that is interested in anything I have mentioned during this review.

39943304.review:
EDIT: As of March 19th, the devs banned me from the game for this negative review and for discussion topics highlighting the dead player base. As of today, THREE players are online. 

Devs ban person for criticism in the forums. LOL. Enjoy your dead game.

--------

Great gameplay and concept. Everything in-game is very fun and I recommend that part of the experience.

It's a GOOD game but the thumbs down means I don't recommend it based on the following:

- 60 fps lock. Keep in mind that by buying this, you're investing in this game's future since it's in early access. No competitive game will even be considered by the masses if it has an fps lock. An fps lock on a competitive game in 2017 is inexcusable. Not mad about it but it's a very poor decision. This game is built in Unreal the same as rocket league which has a 250 fps lock. 

Again, you must realize that this game will eventually die if it has an fps lock. It's predicated on getting the competitive playerbase and ppl wont play this if its fps locked. See Disc Jam.

Full disclosure: com manager said he "forwarded my concerns" to the devs. To me, this means nothing although the effort is appreciated. I've been around early access games long enough to know that dev/manager promises mean nothing (features such as multiplayer are always teased/hinted at by devs but no concrete answer is every given)

- Low player base. On launch this had 650 players on steam charts. No players at all in OCE or SEA. I queued both for hours during beta and for a bit on launch and no human players at all. All AI matches the entire time. So I guess all players are EU/NA. 

(EDIT Feb 14th 1 week after launch the current player base is 72 players. Proof: https://imgur.com/a/ZvCUX)

What the game needs is a console release with crossplay. Would be amazing and instantly make the game huge. I highly recommend WAITING to see how the devs respond to this. I was told a console release is "planned". Again, it's early access so waiting and seeing is fine. 

Again, this is what killed Disc Jam, which had a very decent launch on twitch among rocket league pros and others. There just isn't enough PC steam players to keep it going. It needs console or something else. 

TLDR: Great game but two major hurdles to you getting your full money's worth: fps lock in a competitive game & lack of playerbase upon launch. These may be remedied in the future. Since it's early access, I recommend waiting and seeing.

This game is a ton of fun, more that it look's to be. 3v3 or 2v2, grab nodes to start your lasers, they have a time limit so you can get them off the enemy if you're fast enough or if you're playing thief you can steal them, wipe out the entire enemy team, you can revive your allies by walking over where they died. The longer you go the more intense it will get, you have 5 classes to choose from. 

Shock being my personal favourite because you dont really need any skill to use it, its an aoe stun, that stuns(obviously) your enemy in place ready for them to get fucked by your lasers. 

Thief as I said can steal nodes from the enemy team, 

Blade can dash and insta kill 1 enemy. 

Sniper places down a point anywhere on the arena, if you decide to teleport to it while an enemy is walking through your line of sight you will kill your enemy (if they are inbetween you and your teleport point). 

Ghost allows you to hover through the enemies lasers and makes you pretty much invunrable to there attacks too.

Smash, you weild a big fat shield that you can tackle enemies sending them flying hopefully into a laser, its pretty funny to see.

The Customisation is really nice, there are a totaly of 60 characters to choose from and 5 factions, each having there own style. Emotes you can use (1, 2, 3, 4 keys) in the arena. Portraits that change your body shape and skin colour and lastly you can change your laser pattern, all this can be obtained for free by leveling up.

I'm personally really bad at this game, try my best but still find it a ton of fun. I'd say its worth it.

The gameplay is very balanced and there isn't a single class that is overpowered but I feel that the Snipe class needs to be changed as not many people use it too often because it's almost useless (the Blade class is better and easier to use).

I played it during the open beta and for an early access game, it looks very promising. It's a lot of fun with friends and I'd definitely buy, especially if it's on sale.
